intro: Gerascanthus cochinchinensis, commonly known as the Vietnamese flame tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces woody pods that contain seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in full sun.
